titlestmt.titleproper: The King Danced in the Market Place 1957-1964
The King Danced in the Market Place

change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: The King Danced in the Market Place 1957-1964
did.abstract: Original typescript with holograph notes and corrections; introduction, notes and bibliography for the published version; and offset publication for the original thesis submitted in partial fulfillment of requirements for degree of Doctor of Letters from Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Mexico, 1957. Relates Aztec history and the life of Montezuma, a 15th century Aztec king. Also includes original drawings and tracings from Aztec codices, a Spanish summary of the books, genealogical diagrams for relatives of Moteczuma Ilhuicamina, and photograph negatives of Aztec drawings.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

did.langmaterial: Materials are in English, with summary of book in Spanish.

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: The King Danced in the Market Place (MS 005). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Folklorist, author, and educator; University of Arizona faculty member, 1928-1973.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 2 series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Original typescript with holograph notes and corrections; introduction, notes and bibliography for the published version; and offset publication for the original thesis submitted in partial fulfillment of requirements for degree of Doctor of Letters from Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Mexico, 1957. Relates Aztec history and the life of Montezuma, a 15th century Aztec king. Also includes original drawings and tracings from Aztec codices, a Spanish summary of the books, genealogical diagrams for relatives of Moteczuma Ilhuicamina, and photograph negatives of Aztec drawings.
